intro: Guarea alborosea, commonly known as white-rosewood, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to its dense, durable wood, it has been historically valued for furniture and musical instruments.
